The easiest way to enter Tampico is via the international airport. There is one flight per day to/from
via United Airlines, and several others via

.

Alternately, Tampico is located a six-hour drive from the Mexican border with either

Driving is the easiest way to travel around Tampico. Speed limits and red lights are enforced - other laws tend to be rather lax.

Taxis are relatively safe to take in and around Tampico at any time of day or night, but as always, use caution when traveling alone.

value: - Several times a year, the local cattle ranchers host a matador show, which usually lasts 3-4 days.
downtown, with nearby market, beautiful old cathedral, and very good shopping.
alt=Museo de la Cultura Huasteca, INAH
content=Cp. Ma. Alejandrina Elias Ortiz, 833 256 8717. Guided tours available. Daily 10am-6pm. Adults 33 pesos, students free.
content=(METRO). Opened in 2004, featuring international ballet and symphony.

is a popular beach destination for residents of Monterrey. The beach is safe and relatively clean, though some work needs to be done by the local residents and authorities on this count, especially during the high season.
, on the northwest corner of the main square, is a good place to eat or drink a beer with a great view of the square, but expect to pay more than you might elsewhere.

, A few minutes away from the Tampico "Zona Dorada"  this fine cuisine restaurant is located, where the customers can eat some of the mexican most famous dishes. With fair prices is certainly a must in your next visit to the city.
, 405 Heroes del Canonero, is a life-saver.  Decent beer, good pool tables and an affable barkeep/owner.
address=16 de Septiembre #702 PTE Ampliacion de la Unidad Nacional

content=Mexican "Antojitos", good variety of Mexican food and delicious deserts!
It's open from Thursdays to Tuesdays from 7pm to almost 12am.

content=A great budget option, the rooms have fans and private bathrooms with hot water. No attached or included parking, but if you're traveling by motorcycle they'll let you roll your bike into the lobby for the night.
